properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued January 9 at 9:41PM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, minor lakeshore
flooding. For the Lakeshore Flood Watch, significant lakeshore
flooding possible.

* WHERE...St. Clair County.

* WHEN...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, until 11 AM EST
Friday. For the Lakeshore Flood Watch, from Saturday morning
through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property
including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure
may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...South winds to 20 MPH into the early
morning morning will cause flooding along Anchor Bay and Harsens
Island. More significant flooding is possible along the Lake
Huron shoreline of the county Saturday and Saturday night as
north to northeast gales are forecast on Lake Huron.
properties.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST FRIDAY... ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
